priority: PRIORITY 2.3: Texas Regulatory Violations and Foreign Qualification Issues
complaint_focus: VA DPOR Complaint - Texas Incorporation Strategy Violations
objective: Document Texas-related regulatory violations affecting Virginia operations

rationale: Lariat Realty Advisors (broker service provider) is Texas-based
Business advantages (no state income tax, low costs, flexible laws)
Multi-state operations strategy (incorporate in TX, operate elsewhere)
texas_incorporation_strategy.compliance_requirement: Foreign qualification in each operational state

lariat_realty_advisors_inc.name: Lariat Realty Advisors, Inc.
lariat_realty_advisors_inc.role: Broker service provider for Kettler Management Inc. and 24+ other property management companies

frisco_address_cluster.significance: Multiple firms at same address suggests shell company operation

foreign_qualification.description: Texas-incorporated entities operating in Virginia and other states must qualify as foreign entities
foreign_qualification.requirement: Must qualify as foreign entity in each operational state
foreign_qualification.finding: Kettler may not be properly qualified in operational states (VA, MD, DC, CT, NJ, NY)
regulatory_implications: Failure to qualify can result in inability to sue in state courts

evidence.virginia_scc_search: Kettler Management Inc. registered in Virginia (Entity ID: 03218674)
evidence.cross_state_analysis: NOT REGISTERED in MD, DC, CT, NJ, NY (verified via state database searches)
evidence.note: Virginia registration exists, but foreign qualification status in other operational states unknown

distance_violation.requirement: Quarterly face-to-face supervision certification for licensees located more than 50 miles from principal broker's office
distance_violation.principal_broker_address: FRISCO, TX 75034 (or 5729 LEBANON RD STE 144553, FRISCO, TX 75034)
distance_violation.conclusion: 1,300-mile distance makes quarterly face-to-face supervision physically impossible

shell_company_structure.concern: May obscure true ownership and control
shell_company_structure.implication: Could indicate fraudulent or deceptive practices
shell_company_structure.regulatory_interest: Shell companies are subject to increased scrutiny
benefits_to_operator: Cost-effective - single address for multiple entities

broker_supervision.issue: One broker (Caitlin Skidmore) serving multiple companies from Texas location
broker_supervision.question: Can one broker properly supervise 38 property management companies across 1,300+ miles?
broker_supervision.supervision_impossibility: 1,300-mile distance makes active supervision physically impossible

privacy_vs_transparency.implication: Regulatory agencies may have difficulty tracking ownership

broker_service_provider.service: Provides licensed brokers to property management companies

elizabeth_saye.name: Elizabeth Saye (Liddy Bisanz Saye)
elizabeth_saye.connection: Associated with Burlington Capital Properties (one of Skidmore's supervised firms)
elizabeth_saye.address_match: Same Frisco address (5729 Lebanon Rd #144553) as Skidmore's license address
elizabeth_saye.significance: Direct connection between Lariat and Skidmore-supervised firm

Professional network connections between Lariat and Skidmore-supervised firms

penalties: Inability to sue in state courts
